title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Usage (Licence
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Area Usage (Licence 

Conditions) Regulations 2023. 

Definition
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited maritime area usage (licence conditions) regulation 2023 definition

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: In these Regulations “Act” means Maritime Area Planning Act 2021
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations “Act” means Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 

(No. 50 of 2021). 

Additional licence conditions
text_norm: 2 regulation act mean maritime area planning act 2021 (no 50 2021) additional licence condition

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: 3. The following additional conditions are specified for the purposes of
text_raw:
3. The following additional conditions are specified for the purposes of 
paragraph 18 of Schedule 8 to the Act which may be attached by the MARA to 
a licence, namely, a condition: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

to provide for the payment of fees by the holder of a licence; 

requiring the holder of a licence to notify the MARA of the 
commencement, termination, suspension or resumption of the 
maritime usage and of any other matters or events relevant to the 
maritime usage that may be specified in the conditions; 

postponing the coming into effect of a licence pending 
compliance with certain other conditions attached to the licence; 

arising out of an appropriate assessment carried out by MARA 
under section 117 of the Act; 

for or in connection with the rehabilitation and restoration of the 
maritime area relevant to the maritime usage the subject of a 
licence; 

for or in connection with the protection and enhancement of the 
environment relevant to the maritime usage the subject of a 
licence; 

for or in connection with the protection of archaeological and 
historical heritage in the maritime area; 

for or in connection to the protection, enhancement and 
restoration of— 

(i) 

fisheries or navigation and navigational safety in, or 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 10th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [530] 3 

(ii) public use and amenity of, 

the maritime area; 

(i) 

specifying the steps that must be taken by the holder of a licence 
when force majeure or other change of circumstances prevents 
one or both of the following - 

(i) 

(ii) 

the holder from discharging (whether in whole or in part) 
an obligation of the holder under the licence or the Act, or 

 the MARA from discharging (whether in whole or in part) 
an obligation of the MARA under the licence or the 
Act where the obligation relates, whether in whole or in 
part or directly or indirectly, to the holder. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

2 November, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [530]

title: Maritime Area Planning Act 2021 (No. 50 of 2021), after consultation with the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for additional conditions that the MARA may attach 
to a licence for a maritime usage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [530] 5
